flawed_nl_solution:
Through March, Dr. Banks gave out 53 + 67 + 46 = <<53+67+46=166>>166 toothbrushes.
Before giving away toothbrushes in April, he had 330 -166 = <<330-166=166>>166 toothbrushes remaining.
Between April and May, he gave out the remaining 166 / 2 = <<166/2=83>>83 toothbrushes each month.
The difference would be 83- 46 = <<83-46=37>>37 more toothbrushes in the busiest month.
#### 37

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 164, not 166. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
